message.content:
{"id": "41039", 
"title": "Hitting the Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog doesn't perform a search operation on Mac OS X", 
"description": "When using Eclipse 3.0 M2 (Build id: 200307181617) on Mac OS X 10.2.6, an issue is observed in the Find/Replace dialog. After opening the dialog (Edit -> Find/Replace) and entering a search term into the text box, pressing the Enter/Return key does not initiate a search operation. The expected behavior is that pressing the Enter/Return key should perform a 'Find' operation, equivalent to clicking on the 'Find' button in the dialog, which is highlighted as the default button.", 
"OB": "1) Open Eclipse 3.0 M2 (Build id: 200307181617) on Mac OS X 10.2.6. \n2) Open the Find/Replace dialog (Edit -> Find/Replace). \n3) Enter a search term into the text box. \n4) Press the Enter/Return key. \n\nResults: Nothing happens.", 
"EB": "The Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog should trigger a search operation when a search term is entered in Mac OS X.", 
"SR": "The Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog should perform a 'Find' operation, similar to clicking on the 'Find' button in the dialog, when a search term is entered on Mac OS X."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '41039', 'title': "Bug 41039Hitting the Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog doesn't do anything on Mac OS X", 'description': "Bug 41039Hitting the Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog doesn't do anything on Mac OS X ", 'OB': 'Eclipse 3.0 M2Build id: 200307181617Mac OS X 10.2.61) Open the Find/Replace dialog (EditFind/Replace).2) Type in a search term into the text box.3) Hit the return key.Nothing happens.Hitting the Return key should do a "Find" operation (thesame as clicking on the "Find" button, which is highlighted as the "default"button in the Find/Replace dialog). ', 'EB': '', 'SR': 'Eclipse 3.0 M2Build id: 200307181617Mac OS X 10.2.61) Open the Find/Replace dialog (EditFind/Replace).2) Type in a search term into the text box.3) Hit the return key.Nothing happens.Hitting the Return key should do a "Find" operation (thesame as clicking on the "Find" button, which is highlighted as the "default"button in the Find/Replace dialog). '}
